intro: Microchilus, commonly known as the dwarf daisy, is a genus of flowering plants belonging to the family Asteraceae. These plants are characterized by their small, daisy-like flowers and are native to regions in South America. Microchilus species typically grow in rocky or dry environments, showcasing their adaptability to harsh conditions. They have narrow, grass-like leaves and produce small, brightly colored flowers that bloom in the spring. Due to their compact size and ornamental appeal, they are often cultivated in gardens and rockeries.
